data.title: Destination = Best coffee shop in Hemet
data.text: This is a very nice coffee/sandwich shop with an excellent outdoor patio, attached to the depot building of the Hemet Museum. In search of good coffee in Hemet, this ranks at the top #1 imho, and it's a much nicer place to hang out than a typical coffee shop.

data.title: 5* Food Across the Entire Menu
data.text: Anticipated a decent up of coffee and a sandwich.  Received outstanding options and came repeatedly to try several.  Highlight right off the bat was Hong Kong Lavender Green Tea Latte.  I could drink them all day.  Amazing.  Paninis, Sandwiches, and Wafflewiches, all excellent.  My favorites are Capri (mozzarella, pesto, tomato, and basil) & the Copenhagen (muenster, pork belly, & tomato), both paninis.  The sandwich I love is the Santorini (hummus, spinach, avocado, onion, cucumber, sprouts, roasted red peppers and herb spread) and, of course this wonderful place also supports local musicians and artists.  Oh, did I mention that the Wafflewich not to be missed is the Monte Carlo?  There are vegetarian and gluten free options.  Cupcakes - that's my next guilty pleasure.
